joke: My landlord texted saying we need to meet up and talk about how high my heating bill is. I replied back: 'Sure, my door is always open.'
author: HopelessAdventurer213

comments.author: DarkerThanDark1
comments.text: Brilliant response to the landlord.

comments.author: CommenterRenter2
comments.text: Clever play on words with the 'door always open' reply.

comments.author: WeTheBestMusic3
comments.text: That's hilarious! Great way to handle the situation.

comments.author: Necromancer
comments.text: Not funny. I don't get it.

comments.author: LocustServette12
comments.text: Didn't understand. Maybe I'm missing something.

joke: What do you call a bear with no teeth? A gummy bear.
author: Kanikuly

comments.author: AliceInWonderland
comments.text: Haha, that's a classic! Made me smile.

comments.author: Bob123
comments.text: Simple but funny. Good one!

comments.author: Charlie the Wallflower
comments.text: I can imagine the bear's struggle with gummy snacks. Nice joke!

comments.author: David&Goliath
comments.text: A bear with no teeth, got me chuckling. Thanks for sharing!

joke: Why did the scarecrow win an award? Because he was outstanding in his field.
author: Sauron21

comments.author: Jenny87
comments.text: Haha, this one got me! Reminds me of my grandpa's cornfield jokes. Good times!

comments.author: ChrisLaughs
comments.text: Nice play on words! I can imagine the judges appreciating a good pun. Well done!

comments.author: NatureLover22
comments.text: As someone who spends a lot of time outdoors, I appreciate a good field joke. Clever and amusing!

comments.author: HumorFanatic
comments.text: This is the kind of joke I'd share with my friends. Simple, yet effective. Thumbs up!

joke: Why did the chicken cross the road? To get to the other side.
author: GothamNeedsMe123

comments.author: ComedyEnthusiast
comments.text: Classic! This one never gets old. Simple, yet timeless humor.

comments.author: LaughOutLoud123
comments.text: Haha, I remember hearing this as a kid. It's like the OG of jokes. Love it!

comments.author: JokeMaster
comments.text: Ah, the chicken-crossing-the-road joke, a true legend in the world of humor. Always a crowd-pleaser!

comments.author: FunnyBoneTickler
comments.text: I've heard countless jokes, but this one remains a classic. It's the kind of joke that brings a smile every time!

joke: Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything.
author: TroyAndAbedInTheMorning

comments.author: ScienceGeek22
comments.text: Ah, the classic atom joke! It's like the cornerstone of science humor. Love it!

comments.author: JokeAficionado
comments.text: One of my all-time favorites! Science jokes always have that extra 'element' of wit. Great choice!

comments.author: ChemistryChuckles
comments.text: Brilliant play on words! I can't help but laugh every time I hear this joke. Science humor at its best!

comments.author: WittyMind
comments.text: Haha, as a science enthusiast, this joke is right up my alley. It's so clever and always brings a smile!

joke: Why did the bicycle fall over? Because it was two-tired.
author: ComeOnEileen11!!!

comments.author: CyclistLaughs
comments.text: Haha, the classic bicycle joke! Never gets old. It's like the kickstand of humor – always reliable!

comments.author: JokeWheelie
comments.text: I love a good bike joke! This one really rolls into the realm of punny humor. Nice pick!

comments.author: GigglesOnGears
comments.text: Two-tired, get it? Brilliant play on words! I can imagine the poor bike wobbling. Great joke!

joke: Why did the chicken go to the seance? To talk to the other side!
author: PoorOldJohnyRay

comments.author: FeatheredLaughs
comments.text: Haha, a poultry in the paranormal! This joke cracks me up every time. Clever play on words!

comments.author: SpiritChick
comments.text: Love it! The chicken seeking spiritual advice is both amusing and imaginative. Great choice!

comments.author: LaughMedium
comments.text: Chicken jokes always have a special place in my humor collection. This one is a cluckin' good time!

comments.author: PoultryPunchline
comments.text: The chicken's quest for the other side is hilarious! It's like a feathered comedy adventure. Well done!

joke: Why did the coffee file a police report? It got mugged!
author: OOOOOOO

comments.author: CoffeeLover123
comments.text: Haha, the coffee joke is a classic! Getting 'mugged,' that's a brew-tally good pun!

comments.author: JavaJester
comments.text: Brilliant play on words! This coffee joke always perks me up. Excellent choice!

comments.author: EspressoLaughs
comments.text: I've heard my fair share of coffee jokes, but this one stands out! It's grounds for a good laugh!

comments.author: CaffeineComedy
comments.text: As a coffee enthusiast, this joke is my cup of humor. It's got that perfect blend of wit and charm!

joke: Why did the spaghetti refuse to go to the party? Because it was impasta!
author: StairwayToSteven

comments.text: Haha, classic pasta humor! The 'impasta' twist is always a good one. Great joke!

joke: What did the ocean say to the shore? Nothing, it just waved!
author: Dancing Dean

comments.text: Haha, that's a classic! The personification of the ocean waving is so clever. Love it!

comments.author: HumorSeaside
comments.text: Simple and delightful! The ocean 'waving' without saying anything, brilliant! Great choice!

comments.author: LaughingTide
comments.text: The ocean has the best silent waves! This joke always brings a smile. Thanks for sharing the laughter!

comments.author: JokeByTheShore
comments.text: Ah, the charm of ocean jokes! The 'waved' punchline is just perfect. A true seaside classic!

joke: Why did the computer catch a cold? Because it left its Windows open!
author: TechJester

comments.text: Haha, computer humor at its finest! 'Left its Windows open' is a clever play on words. Love it!

comments.author: ByteLaughs
comments.text: Classic tech joke! The personification of the computer getting a cold is both funny and creative. Great choice!

comments.author: GeekyGiggles
comments.text: I'm a sucker for computer puns, and this one is a gem! 'Left its Windows open'—brilliant. Thanks for the laugh!

comments.author: CodeComedian
comments.text: Ah, the hazards of computer life! 'Left its Windows open' is a tech-savvy punchline. Well played!

joke: As I handed my Dad his 50th birthday card, he looked at me with tears in his eyes and said, 'You know, one would have been enough.'

comments.author: BirthdayLaughs
comments.text: Haha, your dad has a great sense of humor! 'One would have been enough'—classic dad joke. Love it!

comments.author: LaughsWithDad
comments.text: Dad jokes at their finest! Your dad's response is priceless. Happy 50th to him!

comments.author: CardWisdom
comments.text: Your dad's reaction is gold! That's a birthday card moment to remember. Thanks for sharing the laughter!

joke: What genre are national anthems? Country.
author: PurpleHazeDaze

comments.author: JokeHarmony
comments.text: Haha, that's a clever play on words! 'Country' anthems indeed. Well played!

comments.author: LaughsInTune
comments.text: Love the musical twist! National anthems in the 'Country' genre—brilliant joke!

comments.author: AnthemsAndLaughs
comments.text: A musical joke with a patriotic twist! 'Country' anthems got me chuckling. Thanks for the humor!

joke: Why does Dracula always bite people in the neck? Because he's a neck romancer.
author: DracuLaughs

comments.author: VampireHumorFan
comments.text: Haha, that's fang-tastic! Dracula, the neck romancer, strikes again. Love the vampire humor!

comments.author: BiteMeLaughs
comments.text: Classic Dracula joke! 'Neck romancer'—such a clever play on words. Got me smiling!

comments.author: LaughsUnderTheMoon
comments.text: Dracula's romantic side revealed! 'Neck romancer' is a brilliant twist. Thanks for the laugh!
